p: Screening measures can be implemented for long-time periods for specific diseases as part of the countryâ€™s routine measures to prevent introduction of diseases to the country, or ad hoc after emergent public health events. Moreover, screening measures could be implemented massively to all inbound or outbound travelers at a point of entry, or targeted to specific travel routes (e.g., departing from an affected area) or to specific travelers (e.g., who have been in an affected area).
